factText: Some 20,000 people remain evacuated from their homes, the American Red Cross said in a news release Saturday.

More than 60,000 homes and businesses were still without power as of Saturday afternoon, according to poweroutage.us. Earlier this morning, there were reports of widespread trees down across eastern Jackson County with thousands of power outages, according to emergency management.
The evacuation order was set to go into effect at 6 p.m. Sunday. Tropical Storm Watches remain in effect for the FL Panhandle.

Sally could be a hurricane making landfall along the northern Gulf Coast. (Photo: NOAA). It will make landfall, likely as a weak hurricane along the central Gulf coast Tuesday or Wednesday. The storm is expected to reach at least Cat 1 hurricane strength before making landfall from SE Louisiana to Alabama by Monday. Another hurricane could make landfall on the Gulf Coast - and while Texas may see little if any impact, our friends in Louisiana could be the target.

It is expected to move northwest and strengthen, possibly into a hurricane before landfall near the Louisiana/Mississippi border. The system is expected to strengthen more as it moves northwest toward the Northern Gulf Coast and is forecast to become a hurricane before landfall Tuesday. The tropical storm is forecast to  continue moving in that direction until it slows down and makes a turn toward  the north-northwest on Tuesday.
